SKATER COLLECTION

Skateboarding culture has become increasingly popular worldwide in recent years. Shinpei Ueno and Alex Olson, both skaters who started out on the streets, are now active in multiple fields, including fashion, design, and film. This collection features their artworks drawn exclusively for UT and a newly developed T-shirt silhouette.

Shinpei Ueno
As well as overseeing TIGHTBOOTH PRODUCTION, he also skates for Evisen Skateboards as a pro skater. He has released many skateboarding videos, and his most well-known work, “LENZ II,” was highly acclaimed both in Japan and abroad. He works in a wide variety of fields, including direction for a skate shop and apparel brand, and production for numerous brands. “LENZ III,” which completes the TIGHTBOOTH skateboarding video trilogy, was released worldwide in November 2022.

© Shinpei Ueno

items.longDescription:
Yusuke Hanai

Yusuke Hanai is a renowned graphic artist known for his unique style, heavily influenced by the counterculture of the '50s and '60s. He seamlessly blends Japanese aesthetic sensibility with retro American illustration. This collection of graphic T-shirts is based on the theme of "ONE STEP FORWARD," promoting environmentally conscious actions, and features his latest artwork printed on fabric made from recycled polyester.

Yusuke Hanai
Born in 1978, Yusuke Hanai is a globally recognized artist, having exhibited his works in various countries including the United States, France, Australia, Brazil, Taiwan, England. His style, characterized by its cynical and humorous storytelling, has garnered widespread attention both in Japan and internationally.

© Yusuke Hanai

Alex Olson
Alex Olson is a creative from Los Angeles, California, best known for his professional skateboarding from 2007 to 2021. He’ s the founder of the two brands, Bianca Chandon and Call Me 917. Recently, he’ s moved back to Los Angeles from New York City. He wanted to be closer to family and surf in unbearably crowded lineups. Alex now spends his time working on his brands, commissioned designs, meditation workshops and making music for various clients.

© Alex Olson

items.longDescription:
UT ARCHIVE Andy Warhol / Keith Haring / Jean-Michel Basquiat

“UT Archive” is a project that revives carefully selected T-shirts which have been sold in the past. From the UT collection that has been on sale for about 20 years, popular patterns by Andy Warhol, Basquiat, and Keith Haring will be re-released.

Andy Warhol
As the preeminent American artist of the 20th Century, Andy Warhol challenged the world to see art differently. This product is produced under a license from The Andy Warhol Foundation for the Visual Arts, Inc., a New York not-for-profit corporation which promotes the visual arts.

Keith Haring
A key figure in New York’s East Village scene in the late 1970s and 80s, American artist Keith Haring’s artwork populated not only art galleries, but also the city’s subways, streets, and sidewalks. His work often combined an iconographic vocabulary, including hearts, flying saucers, winged figures, and a crawling “radiant baby,”with abstract marks and patterning.

Jean-Michel Basquiat
An icon of New York in the 1980s, Jean-Michel Basquiat became renowned during his short career for works inspired by his early street art and a distinctive iconography often connected to art history. His paintings, drawings, and prints drew on a diverse range of sources, from African, Aztec, and Greek cultures to Americana in the form of jazz, baseball, and social and political events.

©/®/™ The Andy Warhol Foundation for the Visual Arts, Inc.
© Keith Haring Foundation. Licensed by Artestar, New York.
© Estate of Jean-Michel Basquiat. Licensed by Artestar, New York.

As the preeminent American artist of the 20th Century, Andy Warhol challenged the world to see art differently. This product is produced under a license from The Andy Warhol Foundation for the Visual Arts, Inc., a New York not-for-profit corporation which promotes the visual arts.

Keith Haring
A key figure in New York’s East Village scene in the late 1970s and 80s, American artist Keith Haring’s artwork populated not only art galleries, but also the city’s subways, streets, and sidewalks. His work often combined an iconographic vocabulary, including hearts, flying saucers, winged figures, and a crawling “radiant baby,”with abstract marks and patterning.

Jean-Michel Basquiat
An icon of New York in the 1980s, Jean-Michel Basquiat became renowned during his short career for works inspired by his early street art and a distinctive iconography often connected to art history. His paintings, drawings, and prints drew on a diverse range of sources, from African, Aztec, and Greek cultures to Americana in the form of jazz, baseball, and social and political events.

©/®/™ The Andy Warhol Foundation for the Visual Arts, Inc.
© Keith Haring Foundation. Licensed by Artestar, New York.
© Estate of Jean-Michel Basquiat. Licensed by Artestar, New York.

items.longDescription:
Graphic design inspired by Dragon and Tiger, a pair of paintings from a six-paneled folding screen by Hasegawa Tōhaku (1539–1610), one of the great painters of the Azuchi-Momoyama period.
Noted for its dynamic composition and powerful brushstrokes, this masterpiece depicts a standoff between a dragon (summoner of clouds) and a tiger (stirrer of wind). For this collection, we’ve recreated the majestic dragon on a cream background the color of Japanese washi paper.

Japanese Art from the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston

The Museum of Fine Arts, Boston, is one of the premier art institutions in the world. The museum is renowned for its vast collection of Japanese artwork and long history of cultural exchange with Japan. A selection of the museum’s masterworks from Japan can now be enjoyed in a new collaboration with UNIQLO, inspired by iconic designs including Kawanabe Kyōsai’s Wind God and Thunder God, Hasegawa Tōhaku’s Dragon and Tiger.

items.washingInformation:
Hand Wash
Rinse thoroughly in water at 30 degrees Celsius / 86 degrees Fahrenheit or less before putting in a washing machine.
Soaking for around 30 minutes with the absorbent layer facing downwards will make it easier to remove stains.
Machine Wash
Wash in a laundry net. Avoid washing with bleach or softener, as this may reduce the absorbency.
Dry
Allow to dry naturally. Do not use a dryer.

items.longDescription:
Introduction of Detective Conan (Case Closed)

After solving a case, high school detective Shinichi Kudo witnessed men dressed all in black engaging in suspicious activity. In an attempt to silence him, they force-fed him a mysterious drug that caused his body to shrink to that of a first grader. Gosho Aoyama's mystery manga "Detective Conan (Case Closed)", which began serialization in "Weekly Shonen Sunday" in 1994, is now a very popular manga with more than 100 volumes. This original design, featuring fan-favorite scenes from the original manga and art from the TV anime, is available only at UNIQLO.

©Gosho Aoyama/1996,2023 Shogakukan, YTV, TMS

Hypebeast is a global media platform that focuses on the progression of culture. Four Hypebeast collaborators have come together to curate its own community club, with its unique concept incorporated into the apparel designs. The collection features graphics that are made exclusively for UT and a newly developed T-shirt silhouette.

FaZe Clan
FaZe Clan is a digital-native lifestyle and media platform rooted in gaming and youth culture, reimagining traditional entertainment for the next generation. Founded in 2010 by a group of kids on the internet, FaZe Clan was created for and by Gen Z and Millennials, and today operates across multiple verticals. FaZe Clan’s roster of more than 100 influential personalities consists of engaging content creators, esports professionals, world-class gamers and a mix of talent who go beyond the world of gaming.

©Faze Clan. All rights reserved

items.longDescription:
The design is based on a Nishikie of "Kabuki Juhachiban", with "Oshimodoshi" printed on the front and the rest of the plays of Kabuki Juhachiban on the back.
Kabuki Juhachiban" is a series of 18 plays established by Danjuro Ichikawa VII from the family arts that have been well-received since his ancestors. Nishikie are multicolor ukiyoe prints, and many works related to Kabuki, such as yakusha-e (portrayals of actors) depicting Kabuki actors on stage, were produced and gained popularity. They are equivalent to today's bromides.

Ichikawa Danjūrō XIII, Hakuen | Shochiku Kabuki

In the fall of 2022, the KABUKI Traditional name "Ichikawa Danjuro", which has been in existence since the Edo period, will be revived for the first time in nine years. Ichikawa Danjuro XIII, Hakuen was born. To commemorate the succession, T-shirts were designed with the themes of "costumes," "kumadori," and "nishiki-e," which are symbols of KABUKI. This piece of t-shirts conveys the appeal of KABUKI, a traditional Japanese culture.

©In Association with Shochiku

One-point embroidery in neon colors and back prints evoke the 80’s and 90’s. A simple design with a pop edge.

Mickey Mouse x Keith Haring

Pay tribute to two artistic greats with this special design featuring Mickey Mouse and Keith Haring's iconic characters. Drawing inspiration from Disney's "how-to-draw" book, Haring's love of art and cartoons shines through in his distinctive style. This collection also includes a trendy, oversized T-shirt silhouette. Celebrate the intersection of two creative worlds with this must-have design.

Keith Haring
A key figure in New York’s East Village scene in the late 1970s and 80s, American artist Keith Haring’s artwork populated not only art galleries, but also the city’s subways, streets, and sidewalks. His work often combined an iconographic vocabulary, including hearts, flying saucers, winged figures, and a crawling “radiant baby,”with abstract marks and patterning.

Mickey Mouse character:TM & ©Disney.
Keith Haring artwork:© Keith Haring Foundation.

items.longDescription:
The graphic motif is based on the symbolic purple Hachimaki, red and white coloring, and crest from the costume of "Sukeroku," one of the "Kabuki Juhachiban.
Sukeroku's chic appearance fascinated people and he was called "the most handsome man in Edo".
Kabuki costumes are an important part of the beauty of the Kabuki stage. Their colors, dyeing, weaving, and embroidery are filled with the skills of many craftsmen and the ingenuity of their predecessors.

Ichikawa Danjūrō XIII, Hakuen | Shochiku Kabuki

In the fall of 2022, the KABUKI Traditional name "Ichikawa Danjuro", which has been in existence since the Edo period, will be revived for the first time in nine years. Ichikawa Danjuro XIII, Hakuen was born. To commemorate the succession, T-shirts were designed with the themes of "costumes," "kumadori," and "nishiki-e," which are symbols of KABUKI. This piece of t-shirts conveys the appeal of KABUKI, a traditional Japanese culture.

©In Association with Shochiku
items.name: Shochiku Kabuki UT (Short Sleeve Graphic T-Shirt)
items.shortDescription: A special piece of t-shirts commemorating the succession to the name of Ichikawa Danjuro, the grand feudal lord of Naritaya.
items.washingInformation: Machine wash cold, Do not Dry Clean

items.freeInformation: - The images shown may include colors that are not available.
items.longDescription:
The front of this shirt is printed with the oshiguma of Ichikawa Danjuro XIII, Hakuen, a KABUKI actor himself.
Kumadori is a unique KABUKI makeup technique. It also has the role of visually conveying the character of the role to the audience through the colors and types of makeup. Kumadori is also said to represent the ridges of muscles and blood vessels. Oshiguma is a copy of the kumadori applied by the actor by pressing it against paper or cloth.

These bold graphics are featured on our new oversized fit silhouette.

M/M (Paris)
Established in 1992 by Mathias Augustyniak and Michael Amzalag as a creative agency, M/M are known for their collaborations with musicians, fashion designers, magazines and artists. Their work combines typography, photography, drawing and sculpture. They have created logos, posters, advertising campaigns, books, albums, exhibitions and more. Their iconic and influential designs and artworks have attracted and captivated people from all over the world for the last 30 years.
